arts.ttl: Serie A | Verona 0-3 Monza: Match Report
arts.sum: In a surprising turn of events, AC Monza clinched their first Serie A win of the 2024-25 season with a resounding 3-0 triumph over Hellas Verona on Monday evening. The match, which concluded the eighth round of fixtures, saw Monza break their winless streak in spectacular style. Prior to this encounter, Monza had struggled to find their footing in the league, languishing in 19th place with just four draws and three losses. In contrast, Verona had managed a more respectable start to their campaign, boasting three wins from their opening seven matches. arts.ttl: Hellas Verona vs Monza to end Week 8
arts.sum: Hellas Verona are one of the two teams, along with Sassuolo, against which Monza have played at least four Serie A matches without ever losing: two wins and two draws against the Veneti. Monza have only picked up four points in Serie A in 2024/25 (D4 L3); two of the three teams without any success in their first seven matches last term avoided relegation at the end of the season: Udinese and Cagliari (relegated Salernitana); each of the three sides also failed to win on MD8.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Verona v Monza: Match Preview
arts.sum: As the Serie A season enters its eighth round, Hellas Verona prepares to host Monza at the Stadio Marcantonio Bentegodi on Monday evening. This match presents an intriguing contrast between two teams experiencing very different starts to their campaigns. Hellas Verona, currently sitting 12th in the table with 9 points, have shown flashes of potential this season. Their recent 2-1 victory over Venezia ended a concerning three-match losing streak and highlighted their resilience.
